title: Potted Fig Tree Care: Water Sunlight Fertilizer Pot Size & MORE

subtasks: MAINTASK: Grow fig trees in containers. SUBTASK: Select an appropriate container size (at least 3 gallons).
Choose a container size of at least 3 gallons for best results.
Apply slow-release fertilizer once a year in spring for nutrition.
Water regularly, using 0.5 gallons per day per 5 gallons of soil during hot weather.
Use well-draining potting soil mixed with organic materials like bark or perlite.
Provide full sunlight (6-8 hours/day) and protect from excess heat if necessary.
Apply mulch (e.g., wood chips) to regulate soil moisture and temperature.
